since_last_update: US macro impulse turned mixed: S&P Global flash Services PMI slightly missed consensus but stayed in expansion; U-Mich final sentiment beat, implying “less-bad” consumer tone rather than a clear slowdown signal (LOCAL).
US political tail-risk marginally reduced after Trump signed a partial funding bill; shutdown-risk premium likely compressed at the margin vs earlier in the week (White House, LOCAL).

Risk tone remains fragile into the weekend: gold pushed to fresh records on geopolitics/uncertainty even as US equities ended the week only modestly lower, consistent with lingering hedging demand (Barron's; AP).
Equity microstructure remains a swing factor: late-day sell imbalances flagged in the last run can amplify reopen/overnight volatility even if the macro impulse is small (LOCAL).
today_focus: Dominant driver check (today/into next session): geopolitical/trade-policy uncertainty appears to remain the key cross-asset narrative supporting gold and keeping equity risk premia bid, even without a large index drawdown (Barron's; AP).

Next-week regime shift risk: heavy mega-cap earnings (Tesla, Microsoft, Meta, Apple among others) + Jan FOMC is the near-term catalyst stack most likely to change the market’s factor leadership (earnings/AI capex sensitivity for NQ; rates language for duration) (Barron's; Investors.com).

Rates/real-yield channel remains the main transmission: any hawkish-leaning Fed communication or inflation-reacceleration read-through would be most punitive for NQ vs ES; conversely, growth-soft data that cools yields would mechanically help long-duration equities but may be interpreted as earnings-risk if broadening (inference; AP for risk tone context).

Gold focus: safe-haven bid looks more narrative-driven than data-driven right now; watch for any de-escalation headlines that could unwind hedges quickly, versus escalation that could spill into equities via risk-premium rather than growth (Barron's; AP).

market_pricing.dominant_driver: Geopolitical/trade-policy uncertainty and its risk-premium effects (strongest in gold; secondary in equities via hedging/vol).
what_market_seems_to_be_pricing: A continued “uncertainty bid” for hedges (gold strength) alongside only modest equity damage, implying investors are paying for tail insurance rather than fully de-risking (Barron's; AP).

Near-term policy rate steady at the upcoming Fed meeting, with the bigger repricing risk coming from guidance/press conference tone rather than the decision itself (inference; consistent with common pre-FOMC setup).

Elevated single-name/mega-cap earnings sensitivity: the index outcome likely hinges on guidance around AI spend, margins, and international exposure rather than just beat/miss optics (Barron's; Investors.com).
underpriced_or_mispriced_risks: Gap risk from weekend/off-hours policy headlines (trade/tariffs/geopolitics): could re-open quickly with thin liquidity and create cross-asset discontinuity (inference; supported by persistent ‘nervousness’/gold behavior in AP/Barron's).

Correlation risk: an adverse mix where equities weaken while yields/real rates rise (tightening financial conditions) is a plausible stress path if the Fed leans hawkish or inflation expectations tick up (inference).
Earnings contagion risk: if one or two mega-caps signal AI capex/margin pressure, it can propagate through NQ via concentration and factor crowding more than fundamentals (inference).

risk_register.risk: Weekend/off-hours geopolitical or trade-policy headline causes a gap move (risk premia widen; gold up; ES/NQ down) with limited liquidity to absorb it.
Earnings-driven factor rotation: AI/mega-cap guidance triggers sharp NQ vs ES divergence; index-level move dominated by a few prints.
Fed communication reprices the real-rate path (hawkish hold): duration shock that compresses equity multiples and pressures gold if real yields rise (or lifts gold if risk-off dominates).
US fiscal/shutdown risk returns: partial funding bill reduces near-term risk, but the next deadline can reintroduce policy uncertainty quickly.

event_warnings: Earnings concentration risk: multiple mega-cap reports mid/late week can dominate index futures even if macro data is quiet (Barron's; Investors.com).
FOMC week: market impact likely dominated by Powell’s tone/guidance rather than the rate decision; expect volatility clustering around the decision window (Investors.com).
If gold is being driven mainly by geopolitics/uncertainty, any de-escalation headline can create a fast reversal; treat gold strength as fragile to narrative shifts (Barron's; AP).
